title: BBC Local Live: Devon & Cornwall on Friday 24 November 2017 - BBC News
summary: woman , 86 , has 'serious injuries ' after 'being hit by car ' .
more than 40 firefighters tackle major house blaze in chudleigh .
council to 'reinvest double tax on empty properties ' .
ex-soldier dennis hutchings ' can not get a fair trial ' .
heroin dealer jailed for killing drug runner by stamping on his chest .
flipped car a mystery to police .
man 'head butts ' van in 'road rage ' incident .
girl 'elbowed in chest during phone theft ' .
former footballer in ice cream business venture .
more news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on monday .

documents.title: our live coverage
text: that 's all from bbc local live in devon and cornwall today .
we 'll be back on monday at 08:00 to bring you all the news , sport , travel and weather updates .
do n't forget spotlight this evening on bbc one at 18:30 with justin leigh and victoria graham .
author: Hayley Westcott
BBC News Online

documents.title: heroin dealer jailed for 'stamping ' indebted runner to death
text: a 20-year-old drug dealer has been jailed for eight years after killing a drug runner in exeter by stamping on his chest .

delton jones attacked 47-year-old jonathan povey , both originally from liverpool , after he smoked some of the heroin jones had instructed he sell and returned to jones with less money than expected .
the pair originally came to exeter to sell drugs to pay off an £ 800 debt owed to a liverpool drugs gang .
nine of povey 's ribs were broken and he collapsed 12 hours after the attack in a flat in exeter .
he died in the royal devon and exeter hospital of a punctured lung and heart failure on 17 march .
jones pleaded guilty to manslaughter and was sentenced at exeter crown court earlier today .
author: Sarah Gosling
BBC News Online

documents.title: ex-soldier dennis hutchings ' can not get a fair trial '
text: a former british soldier charged with the attempted murder of a man in northern ireland can not get a fair trial , his lawyers have claimed .
john pat cunningham , 27 , who had learning difficulties , was shot in the back as he ran away from an army patrol near the village of benburb in 1974 .
an abuse of process hearing took place in belfast on friday .
a lawyer for dennis hutchings , 76 , from cawsand , cornwall , said it was unfair to try his client .
the judge adjourned the hearing until next month to allow the prosecution time to consider and respond to the defence arguments .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: community space 'taking shape ' in devon
text: a new community space that will benefit thousands of people is taking shape in topsham .
work on the estuary community hub started in may and is scheduled to be completed and ready to open next summer .
a grass roots grant - money raised through local developments like ikea in exeter - is helping towards the construction on the site of the old topsham library .
when finished , the hub will have 18 fully accessible rooms and a community garden .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: saracens v exeter ( sun )
text: former gloucester flanker matt kvesic makes his first exeter start in the league as the leaders head to saracens in a battle of the premeirship 's top two .
greg holmes is preferred to moray low at tight-head while sam hill gets his first premiership start at centre since recovering from a foot injury earlier this month .
england duo owen farrell and mako vunipola are not in saracens ' squad , despite being released by england .
nathan earle , marcelo bosch , max malins , ben spencer and vincent koch come in as sarries make five changes .
the two sides last met in the 2016-17 premiership semi-final in may - exeter winning a titanic encounter with a last-minute sam simmonds try .
saracens : goode ; earle , bosch , barritt ( capt ) , wyles ; malins , spencer ; barrington , brits , koch , skelton , kruis , clark , burger , wray .
replacements : tolofua , thompson-stringer , figallo , flanagan , earl , wrigglesworth , tompkins , ellery .
exeter : dollman ; turner , whitten , hill , woodburn ; steenson , white ; moon , yeandle ( capt ) , holmes , lees , hill , armand , kvesic , waldrom .
replacements : malton , hepburn , low , salmon , skinner , chudley , simmonds , short .
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: horses in need of homes this christmas
text: twenty-four horses and ponies are hoping to find new homes and loving families just in time for christmas .
the mare & foal sanctuary have launched their christmas appeal with hopes of continuing this year 's success , which has seen 34 animals rehomed .
one success story is dolly mixture - above - who was found abandoned , tethered , malnourished and pregnant .
rescued by the charity , she and her new foal bon bon recovered and have both found new families .

managing director simon avery said : `` many of them have lived through some truly terrible times and have fought hard just to survive , so to see them happy and healthy , glowing in the love of their new carer , is just incredible . ''
author: Sarah Gosling
BBC News Online

documents.title: firearms amnesty collects 475 weapons
text: devon and cornwall police 's two week firearm amnesty draws to a close this weekend , with an increase reported in the number of weapons collected .
in 2014 , 446 weapons were recovered , compared to 475 so far this year .
the amnesty will end on sunday .
# gunsurrender every # firearm taken out of circulation makes our communities safer and so far that 's 475 weapons and 20,000 rounds off ammo .
thank you everyone !
# firerarms & # ammunition surrender ends this weekend : find it , bring it , surrender it .
more :
of
thanks phil .
ca n't edit but duly noted
the one major frustration with @ twitterid the number of tweets i 've had to re-type because of errors .
frustrating !
kind of sad to see , bottom ones look more like sporting/target shooting firearms than ones a thug on a street corner would have .
shame , really fun activity ( long distance target shooting )
could they this in america ?
asked a very naive person .
author: Sarah Gosling
BBC News Online

documents.title: park and ride would would give penzance 'fighting chance '
text: a businessman is calling for the new penzance park and ride to be opened for december to provide a boost to the town .
but cornwall council says a legal wrangle over a covenant on the land means it wo n't start operating before spring next year .
most of the £ 1.4m for the service came from sainsbury 's when they built their new store on the outskirts of penzance a few years ago .

cornwall council says the car park will provide spaces and a shuttle service to the harbour for people catching the ferry to the isles of scilly as well as a park and ride using scheduled bus services .
it will also have eight coach bays .
the town 's mayor dick cliffe says the car park had to be built quickly or more than £ 1m would have had to be handed back to the supermarket chain .
roger driscoll owns the alverton gallery and thinks any legal problems should be put aside for the festive season .
he added , `` i would say open it up for december , give us a fighting chance .
`` the money was intended to help the town centre so please do so and then resume your legal arguments in january and hopefully have it sorted by easter . ''
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: judge slams luxury hotel for not reporting sex assault
text: a judge has slammed a prestigious adults-only hotel in cornwall for failing to tell the police that a woman had been sexually assaulted during a massage at its luxury spa .
author: Cornwall Live

documents.title: fancy adopting a beaver ? now 's your chance !
text: a scheme to adopt a beaver has been launched in devon .
devon wildlife trust is currently leading a wild beaver re-introduction project on the river otter in east devon and it 's hoped the scheme will raise funds to keep it going .
people can virtually adopt a beaver for £ 30 a month and receive a cuddly toy for signing up .
author: Hayley Westcott
BBC News Online

documents.title: oxygen given to cat rescued from property fire
text: a cat has been given oxygen after breathing in smoke from a fire in barnstaple , devon .
fire crews were called to mill town court after a resident could smell burning in another property .
firefighers found a chopping board on an electrical hob in the building and put out the fire .
they removed the cat from the building and gave it oxygen therapy .

documents.title: man loses appeal against murder conviction
text: falmouth man trewen kevern , who was jailed for life for the brutal murder of a family friend he called `` grandad '' has lost his appeal against his conviction and will serve a minimum of 20 years in prison before he is eligible to apply for parole .
author: Falmouth Packet

documents.title: woman and dog fall down cliff and get stuck on ledge
text: a woman and her dog have been rescued after falling up to 30ft ( 9m ) down a cliff , devon and somerset fire and rescue service has said .
the pair were stuck on a ledge at warleigh point , plymouth on friday morning .
firefighters used a tripe extension ladder to rescue them after a rescue boat could not be deployed because of the tidal conditions .
it 's not clear whether either were injured in the fall .

documents.title: cornwall searches down under for new hospital staff
text: the royal cornwall hospitals trust is looking to australia in a bid to tackle its recruitment crisis .
in september , it had 359 full-time equivalent posts needing to be filled - 155 of those were for registered nurses .
now , the trust has produced a leaflet encouraging doctors in australia to apply for positions here in cornwall .
the director of hr at the trust , katrin asbrey says leaflets have been handed out at medical conferences .
`` we 've had some inquiries .
the advert is still running so we wo n't be able to fully assess what the level of interest is and how successful it 's been until it closes . ''
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: fire destroys £ 500,000 house
text: a large part of a newly restored £ 500,000 luxury home has been destroyed by fire overnight .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: hms sutherland to leave devonport base
text: hms sutherland will leave her majesty 's naval base ( hmnb ) in devonport in the new year to represent uk interests across the indian ocean and into the pacific .
defence secretary gavin williamson announced the plans earlier .
he is currently in plymouth visiting the base .
defence secretary gavin williamson has announced that @ twitterid will deploy to the asia pacific region in the new year to strengthen relations with allies in the area
follow @ twitterid for updates as we prepare for deployment
@ twitterid crate
what
can see you
i 'm divs are n't i
would n't say that much
good deployment
now that 's a deployment !
oh dear , that is such a kind mission .
may i please warn you to be careful as there are nasa sharks there
hope it does n't break down
should be some decent runs ashore
author: Hayley Westcott
BBC News Online

documents.title: weather update : cold with chance of snow on dartmoor
text: it will stay cold overnight with clear spells and occasional showers , which could fall as sleet or snow over dartmoor .
saturday will also be cold , though , with a few showers likely .
maximum temperature : 8c ( 46f )
a real mix of wintery showers/ice tonight some of our routes will be treated twice .
where roads are closed the set diversion will be treated not short cuts so please take care tonight & tomorrow hg
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: twenty-year-old guilty of killing man , 47 , in exeter
text: a man has admitted killing a 47-year-old man in exeter .
delton jones , 20 , of anfield , liverpool , pleaded guilty to the manslaughter of jonathan povey , who is also from liverpool .
mr povey died from chest injuries at the royal devon and exeter hospital in march .
jones had already admitted six other offences including possessing heroin and cocaine with intent to supply .
he is due to be sentenced later at exeter crown court .
author: Hayley Westcott
BBC News Online

documents.title: tisdale eyes improved city showing
text: exeter city boss paul tisdale is hoping for a much-improved performance when his side host accrington stanley in league two on saturday .

tisdale was highly critical of his side after their 3-1 loss at crawley town on tuesday as the gap between the fourth-placed grecians and saturday 's opponents , who are third , increased to four points .
`` they look like they 're on good form , we 're not at the moment , so i think we need to be on our game on saturday , there 's no other way really , '' tisdale told bbc radio devon .
`` we draw a line and we start again , we 're certainly not going to overdo the critique of tuesday , we a team for saturday and we get stuck in and that 's what i 'm asking for . ''
city have no fresh injury worries , with long-term absentees ryan harley , robbie simpson , jordan tillson , luke croll and ryan brunt all still out .
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: 'soul destroying ' theft of trees in exeter
text: police are investigating the theft of three fruit trees from a community centre in exeter .
pear , apple and plum trees were stolen from st katherine 's priory in stoke hill last weekend .
locals say it 's `` soul destroying '' and a `` blow to the community '' .
the stoke hill community association provides a centre for residents and people living in the north of the city .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: poldark 's aidan turner heads for west end
text: poldark actor aidan turner is to swap his scythe for a cut-throat razor in a new stage production that will see him play a psychotic irish terrorist .
the 34-year-old , who stars in the bbc series filmed in cornwall , will make his west end debut next year in the lieutenant of inishmore .
set in ireland in 1993 , the play tells of a paramilitary who exacts bloody retribution when his cat is murdered .
the play runs at london 's noel coward theatre from 23 june to 8 september .
author: BBC Entertainment and Arts

documents.title: weather update : cold but bright
text: it will be a cold but bright afternoon and mostly dry across the region .
some good spells of sunshine will develop with the odd shower possible in the north and west .
it will be cold with maximum temperatures of 9c ( 48f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: adams buoyant ahead of dockyard derby
text: plymouth argyle manager derek adams says his team 's self-belief is growing as they prepare for the dockyard derby at portsmouth .
second-from bottom argyle have lost just one of their last eight games and are one of league one 's most in-form sides .
`` i think the players are beginning to show the confidence that they have in themselves , '' adams told bbc radio devon .

`` they know the confidence that i have in them and i 've said all along that we have a good squad and we 've competed well with all the teams in this division , it 's just unfortunate at times that we have n't got the results that i think we 've deserved . ''
the pilgrims go into the game with all three senior goalkeepers and youth team stopper michael cooper out injured .
it means remi matthews will start in goal with 16-year-old youth teamer max childs on the bench .
ryan taylor , oscar threlkeld and jamie ness are also out .
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: campaigners tell council to abandon river reroute plans
text: devon residents have told their local council to abandon plans to reroute a river around a park in barnstaple over fears it could make the area more likely to flood .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: may 's focus impresses pirates coach
text: cornish pirates coach alan paver says the work ethic of fly-half laurence may is behind his good kicking form .
the 23-year-old has scored 94 % of his kicks in the championship this season .
`` hats off to him , when he first arrived it was n't an area that was consistent for him .
`` gavin ( cattle , pirates coach ) and laurence have worked pretty hard to get a regime together and to get the practises going and now he 's zinging them over , '' paver told bbc cornwall .
`` that really requires a high level of confidence as when you 're out there on your own and you 're faced with a post and the elements , it 's not an easy position to be in . ''
the pirates are eighth in the championship table and are away to richmond , who are one point and two places above them , on saturday .
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: will plymouth port need new customs checkpoint ?
text: roll on roll off ports such as plymouth may need new customs checkpoints if the uk leaves the eu customs union without a deal , it 's claimed .
the government says it 's hoping to negotiate an arrangement to ensure trade remains as frictionless as possible .
but the managing director of brittany ferries is warning that any delays to freight could have serious consequences for jobs and businesses in the south west .
john napton said : `` if you lose anything in the logistics chain , it could affect small businesses and could have serious impact to those with jobs in the region . ''

plymouth city council says it has considered the potential need for new customs infrastructure as one of `` many possible risks and opportunities associated with the uk leaving the european union '' .
author: John Danks, BBC Spotlight

documents.title: cooke appeal is unsuccessful
text: truro city striker cody cooke has had his appeal against his red card at hungerford town turned down .
city 's top scorer was sent off for a dangerous challenge early in the game , which the white tigers won 1-0 .
it means he will miss the next three games starting with saturday 's fa trophy third qualifying round tie away at isthmian league division one south side lewes .
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: girl 'elbowed in chest during phone theft '
text: police are appealing for witnesses after a 12-year-old girl had a mobile phone stolen from her .
the girl was with her 11-year-old brother and was using her phone when a man walked past them , elbowed her in the chest and took her iphone 5 .
it happened at the rear of sainsbury 's in bodmin at about 17:00 on 19 november .
the suspect is described as a young man of average height and build .
both the girl and her brother were unharmed but shaken up by the incident , police said .
anyone with any information is asked to contact police .
author: Hayley Westcott
BBC News Online

documents.title: flipped car a mystery to police
text: police in cornwall are trying to find out how a car ended up on its roof .
officers say no-one was with the vehicle when they stumbled across it in `` a very tight lane '' in carn entral in camborne .
police say they 've had no reports concerning the vehicle from members of the public and are trying to trace its owner .
anyone with information is being asked to get in touch with them .
author: Hayley Westcott
BBC News Online

documents.title: hospital beds reopen after improvement works
text: patients have returned to launceston hospital after major building works .
beds at the facility were closed in september so upgrade works to the roof , windows and flooring could be carried out .
an extra treatment bay has also been created in the minor injury unit .
su buse , matron at the hospital , said : `` we 're delighted to be getting back to normal at launceston and reopen the inpatient beds ready for the busy winter period . ''
author: Hayley Westcott
BBC News Online

documents.title: people urinating on important plymouth building
text: one local man says the public spaces protection order targeting street drinkers in stonehouse is just `` a stunt '' .
author: Plymouth Herald

documents.title: domestic abuse charity will 'break down barriers '
text: a survivor of domestic abuse has set up a charity in cornwall to help other sufferers rebuild their lives .
angela lowe , from redruth , ended up in hospital on several occasions and says domestic abuse is a huge problem across the south west .
victims will be able to get help from the true butterflies foundation either face-to-face , online or through a mobile phone app .
she said : `` there 's a lot of people that do n't report it , do n't go anywhere , too ashamed to do anything about it .
so by actually opening up the app , it will help people talk to other people without that anxiety of facing them initially and i think that will break down barriers . ''
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: woman , 86 , has 'serious injuries ' after 'being hit by car '
text: an elderly woman has `` serious injuries '' after being hit by a car in exeter , police have said .
officers said the 86-year-old was hit by a vauxhall astra and has a fractured skull and injuries to one of her legs .
she was taken to the royal devon and exeter hospital after the crash on thursday on cowick street at 09:15 .
officers are appealing for witnesses .
author: Rob England
BBC News Online

documents.title: devon travel : road partially blocked in newton abbot
text: in newton abbot , station road is partially blocked by an accident near the station and courtenay park road .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: weather update : dry and bright
text: a few showers are likely across some parts of the region this morning .
however it will be turning drier and brighter through the rest of the day with plenty of sunny spells this afternoon .
it will , though , be feeling colder than recent days .
maximum temperature : 9c ( 48f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: cornwall travel : crash in penryn
text: in penryn , there are reports of a crash between a car and a van on treliever road around packsaddle .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: newquay man wins six-figure payout after a30 crash
text: a man from newquay who had depression following a head-on crash on the a30 has won a six-figure compensation payout .
author: Cornwall Live

documents.title: dog walker falls in river
text: a woman has fallen into a river whilst walking her dog in devon .
police were called at 22:30 on thursday to reports of someone in the river exe in exeter .
the woman managed to climb out of the water before police arrived .
she was given a lift home by officers so she could get warm and dry , police said .
author: Hayley Westcott
BBC News Online

documents.title: former footballer in ice cream business venture
text: a life-long passion for ice cream has led to a second successful career for a former footballer .
ex-plymouth argyle striker rory fallon has hung up his boots at the age of 35 after stints at torquay united and truro city .
the new zealand international retired after his country lost out to peru for the final place at next summer 's world cup in russia .
he and his wife now run the cowlick creamery in plymouth .
rory said : `` ice cream has been a passion of mine since i was young .
i remember when my dad was a football coach and he used to do his coaching on saturdays and i used to play my games on saturdays .
then on the sunday we 'd go and get ice cream - if we won .
that would be the treat . ''
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: house severely damaged in fire
text: a detached house in chudleigh , devon has been severely damaged by fire .
emergency services were called to kingsteignton road at about 21:00 on thursday night .
more than 40 firefighters from across south and east devon tackled the blaze .
the property was `` well alight '' on arrival , the fire service said .
it 's understood there were people in the building at the time , who escaped and were accounted for , devon and somerset fire and rescue service added .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: man 'head butts ' van in 'road rage ' incident
text: a man driving a bmw `` head butted and punched '' the windows of a bt van in a `` road rage '' incident on wednesday , according to police .
it happened at about 07:50 on cumberland way in exeter .
officers said both vehicles came through traffic lights at the junction with main road , pinhoe , and merged from two lanes into one , travelling towards sowton .
police said the man left his car and attacked the van .
both vehicles continued along the road , before the man got out of his car again to punch the van , officers said .
the man , thought to be in his 40s , is described as white , about 5ft 9 inches ( 1.7m ) tall , wearing a grey jumper and washed-out blue jeans .
police are appealing for witnesses and dashcam footage .
author: Rob England
BBC News Online

documents.title: cornwall travel : a30 partially blocked by multi-vehicle crash
text: the a30 southbound at chiverton cross is partially blocked by a multi-vehicle crash near the roundabout .
traffic is tailing back towards marazanvose .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: tributes pour in following death of devon schoolboy
text: tributes have been pouring in after the death of a schoolboy in plymouth .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: cancer patients form support group
text: bowel cancer sufferers in the south west have formed a support group to share coping strategies and advice .
with the help of nurses at derriford hospital , the patients have come together to make sure no-one goes through the disease alone .
the nhs says the symptoms of bowel cancer can be subtle and do n't necessarily make you feel ill .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: council to 'reinvest double tax on empty properties '
text: a measure in this week 's budget to double the council tax on properties that have been empty for two years or more is being welcomed by cornwall council which says it can `` reinvest '' the money into `` much needed services '' .
cornwall council says there are currently 1,032 properties that fall into the category and it 's hoped the policy will raise hundreds of thousands of pounds .
on wednesday , the chancellor philip hammond announced english councils will now have the powers to charge an extra 100 % council tax premium for homes that have been empty for two years or more .
councillor andrew mitchell , responsible for housing , said : `` we think we could possibly raise another £ 700,000 a year which we can then invest in much needed services here in cornwall .
we also want those properties brought back into use and i think that it 's a small tool and small help for us to be able to do that . ''
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: more than 40 firefighters tackle chudleigh blaze
text: more than 40 firefighters have been tackling a fire in chudleigh , devon .
devon and somerset fire and rescue service was called to a property `` well alight '' on kingsteignton road at about 21:00 on thursday .
crews across south and east devon tackled the blaze .
it 's understood there were people in the building at the time , who escaped and were accounted for , the fire service said .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: news , sport , weather and travel for friday
text: good morning from bbc local live .
we 'll be bringing you the news , sport , travel and weather for devon and cornwall today .
if you want to get in touch , please email us .
author: Hayley Westcott
BBC News Online
